When an asteroid hits Earth, the amount of damage it causes depends primarily on the asteroidâ€™s kinetic energy, which is given by the equation:

KE = π × 𝞀 × D3 × v212

In this equation KE is the kinetic energy of the asteroid, 𝞀 is the density of the asteroid, v is its velocity, and D is its diameter. Note that the velocity is squared in the equation.

The table lists the masses and velocities of three asteroids.
